name: Hilton Garden Inn Indianapolis Northwest

reviews.text: For a couple of years this was one of my go-to hotels in the Indianapolis area. My most recent trip involved ants in the room. I know ants are found everywhere. I've even had them in my home but I won't be able to get over it in the hotel room. I woke up at midnight and reached for my phone to check the time and ant were crawling all over it. I noticed that they were all over the nightstand. Immediately, I called down to the front desk. They were able to move me to a different room right away.
reviews.title: Won't be staying here again

reviews.text: I've hesitated to write this review because over the years I've had good experiences here however, I know I would want to hear about this if I was considering a stay here. There are worse bugs to have in a room but I'm still checking my suitcase for stow-a-ways from the trip.
reviews.title: Reliable base in Indy

reviews.text: Our daughter is a student at Butler University, and this is our mainstay hotel when visiting. Very conveniently located off I-65 and accessible to the north side of Indianapolis, this hotel never fails us. Typical HGI rooms and amenities, and with an exceptionally friendly and accommodating staff. Ample parking, and a Starbucks just across the road. Didn't enjoy the breakfast offerings at the hotel, however, but there is a full-service restaurant and a bar in the lobby.
reviews.title: Newer hotel, very quiet and comfortable

reviews.text: Normally I stay at the Embassy Suites but this hotel is closer to my family's home in Indy. It's basically adjacent to an office park, and there isn't much to do nearby, but it is a newer hotel, very quiet, no highway noise, and has a great exercise room.
reviews.title: Great staff, comfortable beds, & ample parking!

reviews.text: The staff is also friendly, and if you have time for a drink, you can relax in the very pretty lobby area or even sit on a little terrace.
reviews.title: Shiney and new

reviews.text: I hosted a dinner at this hotel this week that we so delicious and perfect - I had to write my first ever review. My guests raved about the menu, the food, the decorations, the service and the ambiance of the hotel. The hotel is beautifully decorated. Our banquet room looked out over a nice patio with outdoor couches and a fire pit. I would highly recommend this hotel for a wonderful banquet dinner.
reviews.title: What a great dinner
Great hotel for business traveler.
reviews.text: Hotel seemed very new. Good fitness room and pool. Very clean. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Wi-Fi worked great. The ideal hotel for business.
There were many hotels to choose from, so I chose this one because of the low price, the proximity to family and to try the Adjust.Sleep System Bed.
reviews.title: Adjust.Sleep System Beds!!!!

reviews.text: All in all the hotel was fine.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: PLUSES: free Wi-Fi, easy parking, gym, pool, business center
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: I hadn't stayed at an HGI in a while. I was driving in from Chicago late at night and wanted a place just outside the city limited along 65. I arrived about 10:45pm and the parking lot was well lit which is important to me as a solo female traveler. The staff greeted me right away and offered me some bottled water. My room was very clean and had everything I needed. The bed was the pleasant surprise. It is one of those that has a dial to control the firmness. I slept so well that night. Usually I wake up a few times but I didn't once. The breakfast was excellent and the staff in the restaurant was very friendly. This may be my new go-to hotel for late night drives into Indy.
reviews.title: Love the Beds at this HGI

reviews.text: The hotel seemed very new. The rooms were spacious and had very nice furnishings. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was good sized. The bartender was very personable and fun to chat with. The food is very good. My only complaint is the housekeeping. My floor was not vacuumed at least one of the days. The night stands were not wiped down. The sheets were not changed even though I left the card on the bed. If the housekeeping had been up to par, I would have given a 5 star rating.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable and Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The HGI is a pretty nice hotel - decent breakfast, clean and comfortable. I was all set to give them 3 or 4 stars right up until I came back from work last night to find that the maid had left my door propped open with the security bar! There was nothing of value in the room and nothing was missing but it easily could have been. Fortunately the room was at the end of the hall so not much foot traffic would have seen it open.
reviews.title: Room left unlocked by housekeeping!

reviews.text: I called the desk to complain and they told me they would "get back to me" - nobody did so I complained again this morning and was given a free breakfast coupon for my trouble.
reviews.title: A great stay close to Indy downtown without the price!

reviews.text: I'm not very picky when it comes to hotels but I definitely expect my door to be kept locked!
reviews.title: Nice, new hotel but walls are paper thin

reviews.text: This is an almost new property. Very quiet, yet close to highways. Spacious, immaculate rooms, full amenities, great staff. Drive 15 minutes and you are downtown.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Excellent Staff

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during Super Bowl weekend. Although the rate was more than three times what it would normally be, the hotel was not out of line with what other places were charging. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The sales manager Dennis was very helpful and welcoming as well. Although a taxi was 40$ into downtown, the hotel staff always helped with calling a car and securing it. The rooms were average in size but very clean. Beds were super comfortable and the entire hotel was spotless. Complimentary full breakfast in the morning was very well done.
reviews.title: Super Bowl Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my wife and I stayed here after taking in the IU football game in Bloomington--we're from Chicago and didn't feel like driving back up that night. Property is definitely newer, right off 465, nice lobby, tons of parking, Fountain at the main entrance was a nice touch too. Staff was very friendly. Room was good sized, flat screen TV, had a king and mattress and comforter/pillows were excellent. Fridge in room too along with microwave. Got to the pool and it was heated. Hot tub was great. Suburban hotel so pool was nice sized as was the adjacent gym--all super clean. Precor equipment in the gym so definitely nice. Didn't try the bar but did do room service. Fast, person was friendly and food was reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Location looks like it has recently been updated. Has a slightly contemporary ambiance both in the lobby and the rooms. Plenty of parking, easy access to the highway and the staff was very friendly. I would certainly stay at this location again.
reviews.title: Nicely Updated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel because I was unable to book a Hilton in downtown (or any other hotel, for that matter). We only planned our trip a couple of months in advance as this was a mini weekend getaway (there was also a gaming convention downtown, which probably contributed to limited availability).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in New Development

reviews.text: The hotel overall was very nice. We booked during the "great getaway" promotion, which was a good deal. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and we had an overall good experience. The only drawback was the location. The good news is it only takes about 15 minutes to get to downtown. The bad news is....it takes fifteen minutes to get downtown. Because most of the activities we had planned were mostly downtown, this was slightly inconvenient. However, it's in a nice area (I'm assuming a new development) near the interstate and there is also a small strip mall nearby.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel - Would stay here again

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Indianapolis Northwest Hotel Indianapolis
description: Enjoy a refreshing and successful stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Indianapolis Northwest hotel with a selection of comforting and convenient amenities and services. Unwind on a comfortable king or queen size bed and view a movie or select from a choice of premium TV channels on a 32-inch flat screen TV. Catch up with work at the desk and stay connected with family and business with complimentary high-speed internet access, available in every guest room of our hotel in northwest Indianapolis.
